title: How long will Mass. residents have to wait until their power is restored?
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource and National Grid are working to restore power to over 100,000 customers after Monday's blizzard in Eastern Massachusetts.
Eversource and National Grid faced delays due to high winds preventing safe operation of bucket trucks for power repairs.
National Grid aims to restore power by Wednesday night, but some areas may remain without power until Thursday.

title: 15 prospects Patriots fans should know entering the 2026 NFL Combine
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots hold 11 draft picks, including the 31st overall, for the 2026 NFL Draft.
Patriots are focusing on improving edge defense and offensive weapons for QB Drake Maye in the upcoming draft.
Key prospects include WR KC Concepcion, Edge Zion Young, TE Kenyon Sadiq, and OT Kadyn Proctor.

title: Malden school employee on leave after alleged ‘serious incident’ involving high school student
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A Malden school employee was placed on leave following a police investigation into an alleged incident with a high school student.
Superintendent Timothy Sippel stated the incident involved a Linden School employee and occurred outside of working hours.
No arrests or charges have been made; the district placed the employee on administrative leave to ensure student safety.

title: These Mass. schools are closed for Wednesday, Feb. 25
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Massachusetts schools will stay closed Wednesday due to a historic snowstorm with up to three feet of snow.
School districts on the South Coast and South Shore were most impacted, leading to multiple closures and delays.
Districts such as Attleboro, Bridgewater-Raynham, and Brockton announced closures, while Canton and Sharon reported delays.

title: MBTA to (mostly) resume normal weekday service after historic blizzard
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The MBTA will resume regular weekday service Wednesday after a major blizzard, except for the Fall River/New Bedford line.
The Fall River/New Bedford Commuter Rail line will operate on a modified schedule due to storm impacts in the South Coast area.
MBTA advises commuters to plan extra travel time and remain cautious due to ongoing clean-up efforts after the blizzard.

title: Curran: Patriots could ‘explore options’ to potentially upgrade from Stefon Diggs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs has two years left on his contract but could face a $26.5 million cap hit in 2026.
Patriots may consider cutting or restructuring Diggs' contract due to his age, legal issues, and salary cap impact.
Tom E. Curran suggests the Patriots could explore acquiring a younger, cheaper receiver to replace Diggs.

title: Mass. representatives, including minority whip, to skip State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: House Minority Whip Katherine Clark and other Massachusetts representatives will boycott Trump's State of the Union address on Tuesday.
Rep. Ayanna Pressley will focus on highlighting stories of immigrant children affected by ICE, attending the 'People’s State of the Union' rally.
Sen. Ed Markey and Rep. Jim McGovern criticize Trump's policies, saying the address normalizes 'abuse of power' and 'pathological lies.'

title: Will Charlie McAvoy, Jeremy Swayman be back in Bruins lineup when they resume play Thursday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman might miss Boston Bruins' game Thursday after attending recent Olympic celebrations.
The Bruins sit in the final Eastern Conference playoff spot with a record of 32-20-5 and 69 points.
Team USA's Olympic celebration included a White House visit, delaying some players' return to practice.

title: Could Trent Williams suddenly emerge as a free-agent target for Patriots?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Trent Williams, a five-time All-Pro tackle, could enter free agency due to contract issues with the San Francisco 49ers.
Williams, at 37, remains a top performer and made Pro Bowl appearances 12 times, with a 91.5 PFF grade last season.
New England Patriots need to reinforce their offensive line, and Williams would strengthen it if contract terms are agreed.

title: Boston ends snow emergency parking ban; residents can use space savers until Thursday evening
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston lifted its snow emergency parking ban Tuesday at 6 p.m. after a blizzard dumped 17 inches of snow.
Residents using discounted garages must remove vehicles by 8 p.m. to avoid regular charges.
Space savers must be cleared by Thursday 6 p.m., except in South End and Bay Village where they're never allowed.
